Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [No one is talking in the office, Jim holds up sign that reads "We're on the longest silent streak in office history! Nobody has said anything in... 14 min!", Dwight hangs up on a phone call rather than speak, Andy sees a raccoon eating a hamburger and tries to describe it using charades, Kevin opens a candy bar and takes a bite]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh yeah!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Aw!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Knew it! I knew it! Soon as I heard that wrapper.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You really have to say "oh yeah" every time you eat a candy bar?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I can't help it, Oscar. It's just really good. [takes another bite] Oh yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, not bad at all. I think we can beat 20 minutes though so let's try again. Get it all out now if you have to.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It was a raccoon! Eating a hamburger like a person!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You need to stop banging your pen on your desk or it's going to drive me insane.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, done.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [shows bloody hand] Does anyone have a first aid kit?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Check out this song I wrote: I'ma love you downstairs tonight... [overlapping chatter]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, here we go! Everybody get read in three, two, good luck, one-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [writing on board] Love letters, yes! I love it. What else can be done with paper?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You can write a book about chairs.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Books! Excellent, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy, please! Please, just stop. You can do infinite things with paper-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [gasps] Shh! Did you hear that? Infinity! There is an infinity of things that you can do with paper! Now, who wants to buy some paper? [scattered applause]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Very nice. Very nice sales pitch for our clients that don't know what paper is.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm talking about you guys! Who in this room, right now, wants to buy some paper? Let's get high on our own supply!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Andy, you want us to buy our own paper?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Robert said that we needed to double our sales growth to eight percent by the end of the quarter. That's today. And we're eight hundred and thirty dollars short. And I can't afford to keep buying paper from us. So today, we need to sell eight hundred and thirty dollars of paper and the next quarter I need to sell the twenty-two hundred dollars of paper that's in my garage.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Animals, machines, vast virtual armies. All of these things I have successfully managed. The only thing I haven't managed is people. I saw an ad on the Sabre website for an open manager position in their printers division. I spoke to Robert California about it and he said for me to come by and see him sometime. So, like a Spanish conquistador, I have come to Florida to claim what is rightfully mine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute for Robert California!

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Oh, hello Mr. Schrute. I'll tell him you're here. Can I get you anything at all?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not here to be given anything. I'm here to take what is mine.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Ooh. I'm glad you're on our team. Here, please have a seat.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Dwight? What are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gabe? You don't know?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Course I know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmm. Impressive office you have here. Surrounded by shrubbery, like a squirrel's office.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Corporate says to me, "Gabe, we need you in Scranton." Scranton says, "Gabe, go back down to Florida. You're needed there." So, Tuesdays and Thursdays, I'm up there. Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, I'm down here. I can think of no better way to confront my deathly fear of flying.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Robert.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You made it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Impressive initiative. I don't know what's worse, the trip or the destination. [Gabe laughs] Well, uh, let me settle in and I'll be with you shortly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very good.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey C-span. So my dad says an accountant can really help you out, if they're willing to "play ball." Those were his words.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Gosh, Andy, you had a great quarter. Okay? Robert will understand. Eight hundred dollars is a rounding error!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So make that error!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy, no-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey! I can make that error.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [clicks tongue] Aw...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, it's just, I know that making errors sounds like your kind of thing, but it's a little more complicated than that.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, I-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's just, I really need a real accountant on this. [to Oscar] What do you say?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm leaving early today because tonight I have a trivia contest in Philadelphia.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Any other crunch time, I would love to stay in, cook the books for you so you can save face in front of your CEO, but tonight is Triviocalypse!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's only the biggest night of trivia of the year. There's a thousand dollar prize. I'm committed to my friends, they're committed to me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know what? Go. Have fun.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There's a trivia contest at a bar in Philadelphia.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop right there. I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm in.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I didn't even say what it is.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's trivia.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: In Philadelphia.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But here's the best part. The prize is a thousand dollars, and if we win, we can use that money to buy paper here, close the gap on our eight percent profit increase...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's a great idea.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's a great plan.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah? You like it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, good stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm so psyched you guys are into it because I thought- I was like, "this sounds really stupid."

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You just made a good idea, a great idea.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There is one problem with this plan.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We'd have to leave work, like, right now, to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [on the phone] You can reduce your prices by ten percent or we're going to be finding a new source for our morning bagels. All right. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gabe, I always wondered what it is you did around here. Now I found out. You're the bagel guy.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah. But not just bagels. All unwanted problems. Question: What's the most important appliance in your house?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Meat grinder.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [makes buzzer sound] Too slow. It's the toilet. And I am the toilet of this office. I flush away annoying problems so others can keep their hands clean. And, just like a toilet, I am essential.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know, Gabe? You could have gone with garbage disposal, incinerator or eraser, and instead you chose toilet. God bless you. You're an American classic.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Dwight. Today is not my day at all, I'm afraid. I'm not going to be able to meet with you, but I'm leaving you in the very capable hands of our COO.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But I can give you this pitch in one minute-

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No, he's going to meet with you later. No, no, no. I don't want you to rush it, okay? Trust me. Meet with Bill. He's a great person to know. I'll dialogue with him tonight. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: CEO to COO. What a difference a letter makes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Still an important position. Still a chief.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You're really going to like Bill. He, uh, he has me toilet a lot of people for him. [Dwight sighs, Gabe's phone rings] Hallway phone, Gabe Lewis speaking.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Gabe, listen to me. Don't bother Bill with this. He has to go put out a fire on the home front. Just wait twenty minutes and then I want you to listen to Dwight's pitch. Make him feel valued. Make him feel heard.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Your wish is my command.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: It's a command.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't believe this. What are you doing here, Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You left us no choice, but, this should put a smile on your face. How would you like to be captain of the Dunder-Mifflin team? Although I reserve the right to overrule you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What? No!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I've got a quota to hit. I don't care how I hit it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: And you guys thought this was a good idea?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I thought it was a fun idea.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: There were times on the two and a half hour drive when I experienced doubt. That's the thing about long drives, you know, you're always going to- this is a gay bar.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wait, what? Everyone in here is gay?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes! It's a gay bar! So you guys want to go home now?

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: No. Nah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What does this say about you? That you followed me here? That you think you're going to win your sales quota? At a gay bar's trivia night? [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It says that I believe that my staff's intelligence and that I'm willing to try anything. [Oscar's friend walks up] Not anything.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, all right. We need to divide up into teams, but it's winner-take-all so no need to divide evenly. We need an A-team, a backup team and a just-have-fun team. So you guys all know yourselves.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Good-timers follow me.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Backups. [Jim goes to join the backups]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Go on, kid. You know you don't belong here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A-team.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right, everybody. Nice self-awareness. Except... [looks at Kevin, who has joined the A-team]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's a table over here.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: All right, first question everyone: Ray Charles famously had this state on his mind. What is its capital?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, we got this!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Let's reverse engineer this. You're a black singer. Where do you go? Somewhere where you're a novelty. Alaska?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Atlanta.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh I know you think that, because that's where the Olympics were held.

Quote.Speaker: Cathy
Quote.Text: My cousins were actually at those Olympics.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Keep talking all you want.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: How am I supposed to know what was on his mind? Ooh, what do blind people think about?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay, dogs, canes, signs, manholes, stairs, piano, darkness.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Okay, time's up. Let's get the boards up. "Atlanta, Georgia" is the correct answer. [Kevin holds up "What is...SEE-attle"]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hey man, uh, look. Unfortunately, Bill had to go fight a fire, so your appointment got-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sniffs] There's no fires within eight miles of here.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Well, it's nine miles away. I'm going to be meeting with you on his behalf.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? No, no. Excuse me! Lady! Get anyone from the COO's office on the phone this instant!

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: This must be very frustrating.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I can see you in the jungle now.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Okay, now, you're not an all-star of the NBA, but you did get your game on when you won the NBA's Sixth Man of the Year award in 2011. Who are you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jim, Darryl. Your time to shine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Shawn Marion.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes, Shawn Marion.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That doesn't sound right. I want to say, LaDameon Washington.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wrong, for so many reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, I know Elizabeth Taylor's sixth man was Richard Burton. Is that helpful?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's it. I'm going to go watch the boats on the river.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ron Artest, Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No, it's Lamar Odom. If it'd been Ron Artest, it would have come up in Dancing with the Stars, when they pan over his trophy case when he's at home with his family. Lamar winning Sixth Man was a big storyline on Chloe and Lamar.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: All right, boards up. Let's see who got it. "Lamar Odom" is what we were looking for. "Lamar Odom" Thank you. [scattered cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God. Lamar Odom, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nicely done!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're my sports guys! You're ESPN, you're ESPN Classic, Ryan is MSNBC. I'm E!, TLC and Oxygen.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Chill, man. This plan is airtight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So it's a very simple argument of why I should be put in charge of southeast printer sales. Nobody has sold more printers in the northeast than me. Bottom line, I know the product. I get it!

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Well, you got my vote.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Most of all, I believe that character is destiny. And my character is one that- wait why are you smiling?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's with the smile?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You're doing great. You know, so good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And my character is one that will never give up until greatness is on the horizon, behind us.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Dwight, that was a fantastic presentation. Put your hand on my hand. Flush! [Gabe makes a flushing motion, Dwight twists Gabe's arm] Ow!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Take me to Robert.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ow! He went home.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Take me to his house.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Uh, it's a condo and it's long-term business housing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know where it is. Lead me there.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ow! Ow! Stephanie, help!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen, you're a perfectly fine toilet. I'm just an extraordinary piece of crap. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Excuse me, sir, on the Dunder-Mifflin A-team? Excuse me, sir?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: I'm sure you're just checking your Grindr account... [laughter] but you can't check smart phones during trivia, it's against the rules.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm turning it off.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Okay, you're not turning it off.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I won't look at it.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Sir?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I can't- I can't not touch it.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Okay, then we're going to have to take it away. [employee takes the phone] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Look, I can't, I can't not have my phone. I'm sorry. I want to be with my phone. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: All right, guys. After nine rounds, let's check the scores. In first place, with nine points, it's Aesop's Foibles. [Oscar's team touches fingers] The Queerenstein Bears have seven points. [a team of hairy men growl] Dunder-Mifflin A-Team has four points.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [claps] All right.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: D.M. Backup Team has three points. The Einsteins have eight points. [the "just-for-fun" Dunder-Mifflin team cheers] Ladies Gaga have five points. [more cheering]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So the best chance of hitting our mark is now in the hands, and brains, of Kevin, Meredith, Erin and Kelly. Do I like these odds? My answer is no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which one is it?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I don't know. All I know is the building.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Robert! Robert California! Robert!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Dwight! How nice of Gabe to show you where I live. Come around. 102.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: All right guys, time's up. Who was the relatively unknown patent clerk who discovered that energy equals mass times the speed of light squared? Looks like everyone gets a point for Albert Einstein. Oh wait. Except for the Einsteins. That's all right. Which means the top three teams are going to finish it off in the speed round. So let's get everyone some bells. In third place we have the Einsteins.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What! [cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: In second place, we have the Queerenstein Bears.

Quote.Speaker: Queerenstein Bears
Quote.Text: Whoo! Let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: And, in first place, is Aesop's Foibles.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar's friend
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, we're going to get clobbered.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Ring it in when you know it. First question: This man had a fatwa declared on him when- [Erin rings bell] Einsteins?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I did my part, babe. I'm just the bell girl. [Oscar rings bell]

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Aesop's?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Salman Rushdie.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Salman Rushdie is correct. [applause] Heading out to sea, sailors. On a square-rigged ship, the sale set furthest forward is called what? [Erin rings bell]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Princess Ding-Dong, do not hit that bell unless-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Flying jib.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Flying jib is correct for the Einsteins. [cheers and applause]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Shalom. [sighs] Give us just a minute. Stu and I are just finishing up our lesson. Trust me. One nine-minute bout is a cardiovascular equivalent of running uphill for three hours. [grunt] I could go to the gym three times a week or I can wrestle Stu once a month. [slaps the mat, they wrestle]

Quote.Speaker: Stu
Quote.Text: Grab my knee!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yay Robert!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Guys, please help yourself to some drinks from the fridge.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: According to a recent survey, this is the most common learning disability among American adolescents.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar's friend
Quote.Text: [rings bell] Boom! ADHD!

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: No. [another bell rings]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wrong. The answer is dyslexia!

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: That's correct for the Einsteins. [cheers and applause]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [dances] Whoo! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Sir-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Go Einsteins!

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Dial it back, this isn't Tail Feathers, okay? [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: They haven't really improved on the Oreo, have they?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Sit down, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me tell you why I should be the next manager with a riddle: A manager, a salesman, a leader and a warrior walk into a restaurant. The hostess says, "table for one?" How is this possible?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You were dining alone? All those people are you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, exactly. Riddle number two: Who is going-

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Ah-ah-ah- your drive, your ambition. It would be wasted on a manager's job. And Florida, you don't want to live here. Even I don't want to live here. That's why I'm always at my place in Scranton. Florida is America's basement: It's wet, it's filled with mold, strange insects, alligators. Alligators are dinosaurs, Dwight. You know that, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: N... it's complicated.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [holds a medal to the light] This medal was my grandfather's. He received it for acts of courage. For excellence. It's a tribute one man gives another. I could give you a job, Dwight. Why not let me give you something even better? [holds out medal]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a job interview, not a flea market.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Dwight, the job is not right for you. Now, when something comes along that is right for you, I'll try you out. Now get the hell out of my place.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Final round. Last two teams squaring off. I hope you're ready to play doctor. Our question is about health and the human body.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, come on!

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: The standard American analog scale has a maximum capacity of what weight? [bell rings]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Three hundred pounds!

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: Point for the Einsteins. [applause] Here's your final question. Cinephiles, put on your memory berets: This 2001 masterpiece from Gilles Paquet-Brenner explores the intricate dynamics of a family in disarray.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [rings bell, answers in French] Le titre du film est Le Scaphandre et le Papillon.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar's friend
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, no. Over to the Einsteins.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [rings bell] Les Jolies Choses.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Marie Cotillard exposes herself a number of times in that film.

Quote.Speaker: Host
Quote.Text: The Einsteins win it! [applause]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Look, I know it's easy to say tonight was just a fluke, and maybe it was, but here's a piece of trivia: a fluke is one of the most common fish in the sea. So if you go fishing for a fluke, chances are, you just might catch one.

Quote.Speaker: Stonewall Host
Quote.Text: Welcome to the Stonewall Alliance Trivia Championships! First prize is forty-five hundred dollars!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Let's just do our thing, collect our hardware and get the hell home.

Quote.Speaker: Stonewall Host
Quote.Text: Riboflavin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [holds up "Robitussin"] Riboflavin?

Quote.Speaker: Stonewall Host
Quote.Text: Michigan. [Kevin holds up "A Mitten"] The President of the United States is "P.O.T.U.S." [Kevin holds up "P.O.T.A.T.O."] John Steinbeck wrote The Grapes of Wrath. [Kevin holds up "The California Raisins"]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Cause it's like, really...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Einsteins! Great work.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know what I thought would be fun? Is we do like uh, a switch-em-up maybe? Since only one of us needs to win, maybe I can get Kevin and Kelly and put together an all-star team?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa! Andy, there is no switching teams.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Andy, we're fine. We don't wanna switch. We're already like, the perfect unit.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright. Well just stay focused, try to concentrate.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Whoo! Brought some brain food.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Having fun.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith & Kelly
Quote.Text: One, two, three...[team takes shots]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: When I dropped out of school to watch more sports, a lot of people thought that I was nuts. Well who's laughing now?

Quote.Speaker: Announcer
Quote.Text: Say "Shalom" to your shrubs on this Jewish holiday that celebrates the new year for trees.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Tu Bishvat!

Quote.Speaker: Announcer
Quote.Text: That's correct.

Quote.Speaker: Einsteins
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Announcer
Quote.Text: Point for the Einsteins.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hey, is it true that you're not allowed to spend time with your girlfriend during the month of Tu Bishvat?

Quote.Speaker: Announcer
Quote.Text: Uh, I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I knew it. I knew it. I knew it. Ryan lies to me and says he has a whole Jewish holiday for an entire month.....

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It gets better, kids. It gets so much better that one day, your stupid coworkers will be excited to show up at your gay bar and ruin your trivia night.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright, if you're not going to help us out by buying our own paper, could you sell eight hundred dollars more paper than usual today? That would be amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy, it's the last day of the quarter. We've already called all our clients, so making that much in a day is going to be tough.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not helping, tuna.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm sitting on twenty-five hundred in sales I can make at any time but those are my wait till the separation is legal sales.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We gotta figure this out. Think of the look on Robert's face when we tell him we met our 8% goal.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, will we get to see that look?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, that's why...that's why I said think of it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy, we're gonna do our best. But you know what? At the end of the day seven point...whatever percent is pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, it is, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Have I mentioned that it's also quite good for amateur animation? [flips crude animation of stick figures representing him and Robert] Took me two weeks.
